text: <@UDB26738Q> I saw you mention on a PR that one could use GitHub Codespaces to do BB / Yggdrasil work, which I found intriguing; it really has a working Julia, which is cool! But it is Julia 1.5.3... so I assume that means I have to manually install a suitable Julia build first, right?

elements.text: I saw you mention on a PR that one could use GitHub Codespaces to do BB / Yggdrasil work, which I found intriguing; it really has a working Julia, which is cool! But it is Julia 1.5.3... so I assume that means I have to manually install a suitable Julia build first, right?

text: Yeah, at moment we can't get much better: <https://github.com/JuliaPackaging/Yggdrasil/pull/2364|https://github.com/JuliaPackaging/Yggdrasil/pull/2364>

elements.text: Yeah, at moment we can't get much better:

text: yeah, and I noticed that there is no C/C++/make/... so I can't just  build a Julia in there. Pity

elements.text: yeah, and I noticed that there is no C/C++/make/... so I can't just  build a Julia in there. Pity

text: Actually, now we can have Julia v1.6 beta, but it won't work very well whenever there are jll stdlibs involved

text: well it would work at least on *some* JLLs, I guess (not the ones that'd interest *me*, of course :wink: but perhaps it'd be useful for some other people)
